# FluxMedia

> FluxMedia is a provider-agnostic media upload library for JavaScript and TypeScript. Upload images, videos, and files to Cloudinary, AWS S3, or Cloudflare R2 using a single unified API. Write your upload logic once, switch providers without changing a single line of code.

FluxMedia is an open-source library â€” not a storage service. It wraps existing cloud storage providers behind a consistent interface. The project is organized as a monorepo of npm packages under the `@fluxmedia` scope.

Key capabilities:
- Unified API across all providers: `upload`, `delete`, `get`, `getUrl`, `uploadMultiple`, `deleteMultiple`
- Plugin system with lifecycle hooks: `beforeUpload`, `afterUpload`, `onError`, `beforeDelete`, `afterDelete`
- React hooks (`useMediaUpload`) and components (`MediaUpload`) for client-side uploads
- File type detection using magic bytes (more reliable than file extensions)
- Official plugins: file validation, image optimization, metadata extraction, analytics, retry with exponential backoff

## Documentation

- [Getting Started](https://fluxmedia.dev/docs/getting-started): Installation guide, basic usage, and quick start
- [API Reference](https://fluxmedia.dev/docs/api): Complete API documentation for all packages
- [Plugins Guide](https://fluxmedia.dev/docs/plugins): Official plugins and custom plugin development
- [React Integration](https://fluxmedia.dev/docs/react): Hooks, components, and upload modes
- [Providers](https://fluxmedia.dev/docs/providers): Cloudinary, S3, and R2 configuration

## Blog

- [Getting Started with FluxMedia](https://fluxmedia.dev/blog/getting-started-with-fluxmedia): Step-by-step tutorial for first-time users
- [Understanding the Plugin System](https://fluxmedia.dev/blog/understanding-the-plugin-system): Deep dive into plugin lifecycle, hooks, and official plugins
- [Using Multiple Providers](https://fluxmedia.dev/blog/using-multiple-providers-zero-effort): Guide to switching and using multiple providers simultaneously
- [Why FluxMedia is Not a Competitor](https://fluxmedia.dev/blog/why-fluxmedia-is-not-a-competitor): FluxMedia's relationship to cloud providers explained

## Packages

- `@fluxmedia/core`: Core types, MediaUploader class, plugin system, file type detection
- `@fluxmedia/cloudinary`: Cloudinary provider with image/video transformations
- `@fluxmedia/s3`: AWS S3 provider with presigned URL support
- `@fluxmedia/r2`: Cloudflare R2 provider (S3-compatible)
- `@fluxmedia/react`: React hooks and components for client-side uploads
- `@fluxmedia/plugins`: Official plugins for validation, optimization, metadata, analytics, and retry

## Optional

- [Source Code](https://github.com/codewithveek/fluxmedia): GitHub repository with full source, examples, and issue tracker
- [Changelog](https://fluxmedia.dev/changelog): Version history and release notes
